title: Zinedine Zidane responds to Eden Hazard's awful miss in Real Madrid victory
text:

Real Madrid manager Zinedine Zidane says he is not concerned by Eden Hazard's poor form after the Belgian missed a glorious chance in the Champions League win over Galatasaray.

Toni Kroos scored the only goal in his 100th Champions League appearance to lift Los Blancos off the bottom of Group A on Tuesday night.

It could have been a more comfortable win had Hazard, who arrived in a £130million move from Chelsea this summer, converted his chance with only the goal at his mercy.

But despite the embarrassing miss, Zidane has defended the under-fire Belgian and expects him to deliver the goods soon.

(Image: REUTERS)

"It doesn't worry me," Zidane said. "He's better and he's going to improve more.

"The important thing is that he continues to have chances, because he's going to put them in."

Hazard's team-mate and compatriot Thibaut Courtois, another former Blues player, has also come under pressure after a miserable start to his Bernabeu spell.

(Image: REUTERS)

But again, Zidane has backed his player and alluded to the smart save Courtois made in the first half.

"He has clearly saved us in the first half," Zidane said of Courtois. "We are happy for him and for the whole team – he needed that kind of match as well. He allowed us to get all three points.

"There is always a lot of criticism when we lose and today we won, we played with personality and the players have deserved the victory."
description: A goal from German midfielder Toni Kroos gave Real Madrid their first win of this season's Champions League
